article.headline: Saint Louis 69, Duquesne 59
article.story: ST. LOUIS -- Kwamain Mitchell scored a game-high 23 points, including 16 in the final 9:16 to lead Saint Louis past Duquesne 69-59 on Saturday. Saint Louis (19-9, 10-4 Atlantic 10) won for the seventh time in the last eight games. Willie Reed, Brian Conklin and Cody Ellis added 10 points each for the Billikens. Bill Clark led Duquesne (15-13, 6-8) with 17 points. B.J. Monteiro added 15 for the Dukes, who had their three-game winning streak snapped. Saint Louis went on a 13-2 run midway through the second half to erase a three-point deficit and go in front to stay 55-47. Mitchell scored seven points in the streak. Kyle Cassity added a 3-pointer to the blitz. Mitchell finished 6 of 8 from the field including a 4 for 4 effort in the second half. Saint Louis jumped out to a 15-4 lead before Duquesne rallied to tie the game 33-33 at half.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
